text:
Q: Do indian primary hyperparathyroidism patients with parathyroid carcinoma differ in clinicoinvestigative characteristics from those with benign parathyroid pathology?
A: No. Rationale: Indian patients with parathyroid adenoma, hyperplasia, and carcinoma were not found to differ in their clinical, biochemical, and pathological characteristics except for.
label: No
question: Do indian primary hyperparathyroidism patients with parathyroid carcinoma differ in clinicoinvestigative characteristics from those with benign parathyroid pathology?
rationale_src: Indian patients with parathyroid adenoma, hyperplasia, and carcinoma were not found to differ in their clinical, biochemical, and pathological characteristics except for significantly higher tumor weight in the carcinoma group.

text:
Q: Does obesity adversely affect outcomes after laparoscopic splenectomy?
A: No. Rationale: Obesity does not adversely affect outcomes after LS.
label: No
question: Does obesity adversely affect outcomes after laparoscopic splenectomy?
rationale_src: Obesity does not adversely affect outcomes after LS. The laparoscopic approach is the optimal technique for splenectomy regardless of the patient's weight.

text:
Q: Does glucocorticoid treatment alter early cardiac adaptations to growth restriction in preterm sheep fetuses?
A: No. Rationale: Fetal hearts rapidly adapt to FGR to maintain substrate delivery to the brain and heart.
label: No
question: Does glucocorticoid treatment alter early cardiac adaptations to growth restriction in preterm sheep fetuses?
rationale_src: Fetal hearts rapidly adapt to FGR to maintain substrate delivery to the brain and heart. The FGR greatly enhanced the area of ischaemia, with implications for susceptibility in postnatal life. Antenatal BM treatment does not interfere with these cardiac changes but appears to increase left ventricle β-adrenoceptor responsiveness, which may render the offspring vulnerable to subsequent cardiac dysfunction.

text:
Q: Does low-dose aspirin increase implantation rates in patients undergoing intracytoplasmic sperm injection : a prospective randomized study?
A: No. Rationale: Low-dose aspirin administration does not improve implantation and pregnancy rates in an unselected group of patients undergoing ICSI.
label: No
question: Does low-dose aspirin increase implantation rates in patients undergoing intracytoplasmic sperm injection : a prospective randomized study?
rationale_src: Low-dose aspirin administration does not improve implantation and pregnancy rates in an unselected group of patients undergoing ICSI.

text:
Q: Does bracing improve dynamic stability in chronic ankle instability subjects?
A: No. Rationale: While TTS is a useful outcome tool for identifying deficits in subjects with CAI and improvements related to ankle rehabilitation, this measure.
label: No
question: Does bracing improve dynamic stability in chronic ankle instability subjects?
rationale_src: While TTS is a useful outcome tool for identifying deficits in subjects with CAI and improvements related to ankle rehabilitation, this measure of dynamic stability does not appear to be sensitive in detecting the influence of the application of an ankle brace in this pathological group. Researchers need to establish what other testing methods will be the best for determining the outcome of the application of an ankle brace in the laboratory setting to coincide with the epidemiology data that support the use of these devices.

text:
Q: Is postoperative Leukocytosis After Robotic-Assisted Radical Prostatectomy Associated with Perioperative Outcome and Histopathological Findings?
A: No. Rationale: IPLC was not associated with more favorable tumor biology (lower pGS, better tumor stage) and not influenced by patient conditions (age, body.
label: No
question: Is postoperative Leukocytosis After Robotic-Assisted Radical Prostatectomy Associated with Perioperative Outcome and Histopathological Findings?
rationale_src: IPLC was not associated with more favorable tumor biology (lower pGS, better tumor stage) and not influenced by patient conditions (age, body mass index, American Society of Anesthesiologists score, smoking) or intraoperative parameters (blood loss, operating time, surgeon). In addition, there was no significant correlation with serious complications (Clavien-Dindo Grade 3a/b) within a period of 90 days.

text:
Q: Does the mGluR5 antagonist AFQ056 affect methylation and transcription of the mutant FMR1 gene in vitro?
A: No. Rationale: These results demonstrate that the AFQ056 effect on fully methylated FXS patients is not due to a secondary effect on DNA methylation.
label: No
question: Does the mGluR5 antagonist AFQ056 affect methylation and transcription of the mutant FMR1 gene in vitro?
rationale_src: These results demonstrate that the AFQ056 effect on fully methylated FXS patients is not due to a secondary effect on DNA methylation and consequent transcriptional activation of FMR1.

text:
Q: Is overexpression of p53 in squamous cell carcinoma of the tongue in young patients with no known risk factors associated with mutations in exons 5-9?
A: No. Rationale: These data suggest that the molecular mechanisms by which the young individuals with no risk factors had altered p53 function in oral.
label: No
question: Is overexpression of p53 in squamous cell carcinoma of the tongue in young patients with no known risk factors associated with mutations in exons 5-9?
rationale_src: These data suggest that the molecular mechanisms by which the young individuals with no risk factors had altered p53 function in oral squamous cell carcinoma may differ from those of the more typical population of individuals who have this malignancy develop.

text:
Q: Is warthin 's tumour an Epstein-Barr virus related disease?
A: No. Rationale: These results indicated that EBV is not involved in the pathogenesis of WT.
label: No
question: Is warthin 's tumour an Epstein-Barr virus related disease?
rationale_src: These results indicated that EBV is not involved in the pathogenesis of WT.

text:
Q: Is rECK an independent prognostic marker for breast cancer?
A: No. Rationale: Although it continues to serve as an invasion and MMP inhibitor in breast cancer, RECK expression analysis is not useful for prognosis.
label: No
question: Is rECK an independent prognostic marker for breast cancer?
rationale_src: Although it continues to serve as an invasion and MMP inhibitor in breast cancer, RECK expression analysis is not useful for prognosis of these patients.

text:
Q: Is chlamydia pneumoniae serological status associated with asthma in children or young adults?
A: No. Rationale: The results of this study suggest that C.
label: No
question: Is chlamydia pneumoniae serological status associated with asthma in children or young adults?
rationale_src: The results of this study suggest that C. pneumoniae infection when diagnosed by MIF serology is not a major risk factor for the development of asthma in children and young adults. The study has not, however, addressed the role this organism may play in specific asthmatic subsets or asthma exacerbations.

text:
Q: Does self-efficacy mediate the relationship between transformational leadership behaviours and healthcare workers' sleep quality?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: Our results indicate that training managers in transformational leadership behaviours may have a positive impact on healthcare workers' health over time.
label: Uncertain
question: Does self-efficacy mediate the relationship between transformational leadership behaviours and healthcare workers' sleep quality?
rationale_src: Our results indicate that training managers in transformational leadership behaviours may have a positive impact on healthcare workers' health over time. However, more research is needed to examine the mechanisms by which transformational leadership brings about improved sleep quality; self-efficacy was not found to be the explanation.

text:
Q: Do Web-based and clinic samples of gay men living with HIV differ on self-reported physical and psychological symptoms?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: Our data have revealed a number of differences.
label: Uncertain
question: Do Web-based and clinic samples of gay men living with HIV differ on self-reported physical and psychological symptoms?
rationale_src: Our data have revealed a number of differences. Compared to the clinic sample, the Web-based sample had worse psychological symptom burden, younger average age, higher prevalence of employment, and a lower proportion on ART. For future research, we recommend that Web-based data collection should include the demographic variables that we note differed between samples. In addition, we recognize that each recruitment method may bring inherent sampling bias, with clinic populations differing by geographical location and reflecting those accessing regular medical care, and Web-based sampling recruiting those with greater Internet access and identifying survey materials through specific searches and contact with specific websites.

text:
Q: Can routinely collected ambulance data about assaults contribute to reduction in community violence?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: A hotspots approach to sharing data circumvents the problem of disclosing person-identifiable data between different agencies.
label: Uncertain
question: Can routinely collected ambulance data about assaults contribute to reduction in community violence?
rationale_src: A hotspots approach to sharing data circumvents the problem of disclosing person-identifiable data between different agencies. Practically, at least half of ambulance hotspots are unknown to the police; if causal, it suggests that data sharing leads to both reduced community violence by way of prevention (such as through anticipatory patrols or problem-oriented policing), particularly of more severe assaults, and improved efficiency of resource deployment.

text:
Q: Do somatic complaints predict subsequent symptoms of depression?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: Our findings suggest that somatic complaints may represent one, but not necessarily the most important, risk factor for the subsequent development of.
label: Uncertain
question: Do somatic complaints predict subsequent symptoms of depression?
rationale_src: Our findings suggest that somatic complaints may represent one, but not necessarily the most important, risk factor for the subsequent development of depressive symptoms in women in nonclinical populations. The results also highlight the importance of including social variables in studies on women's depression as well as conducting additional research to further examine predictors of depressive symptoms in men.

text:
Q: Does rugby headgear prevent concussion?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: Although most players in the study believe that rugby headgear may prevent concussion, only a minority reported wearing it.
label: Uncertain
question: Does rugby headgear prevent concussion?
rationale_src: Although most players in the study believe that rugby headgear may prevent concussion, only a minority reported wearing it. Coaches tended to be less convinced than the players that rugby headgear can prevent concussion.

text:
Q: Does ultrasound imaging before puncture facilitate internal jugular vein cannulation?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: Prepuncture ultrasound evaluation did not improve the result of right internal jugular vein cannulation compared with the respiratory jugular venodilation-guided approach.
label: Uncertain
question: Does ultrasound imaging before puncture facilitate internal jugular vein cannulation?
rationale_src: Prepuncture ultrasound evaluation did not improve the result of right internal jugular vein cannulation compared with the respiratory jugular venodilation-guided approach. When the landmark was not observed, however, the prepuncture ultrasound guidance was helpful in facilitating the cannulation.

text:
Q: Is routine intraoperative frozen-section examination of sentinel lymph nodes in breast cancer worthwhile?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: In breast cancer patients having SLN biopsy, the failure of routine intraoperative FS is largely the failure to detect micrometastatic disease.
label: Uncertain
question: Is routine intraoperative frozen-section examination of sentinel lymph nodes in breast cancer worthwhile?
rationale_src: In breast cancer patients having SLN biopsy, the failure of routine intraoperative FS is largely the failure to detect micrometastatic disease. The benefit of routine intraoperative FS increases with tumor size. Routine FS may not be indicated in patients with the smallest invasive cancers.

text:
Q: Is tumour expression of VEGF associated with venous invasion and survival in pT3 renal cell carcinoma?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: Progression of a pT3 tumour into the renal vein and vena cava is not associated with increased tumour expression of VEGF.
label: Uncertain
question: Is tumour expression of VEGF associated with venous invasion and survival in pT3 renal cell carcinoma?
rationale_src: Progression of a pT3 tumour into the renal vein and vena cava is not associated with increased tumour expression of VEGF. However, VEGF is an independent prognostic factor in this group of poor prognosis renal tumours.

text:
Q: Residual fundus or neofundus after laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy: is fundectomy safe and effective as revision surgery?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: LF and cruroplasty is feasible and has good results in terms of GERD symptoms control and additional weight loss.
label: Uncertain
question: Residual fundus or neofundus after laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy: is fundectomy safe and effective as revision surgery?
rationale_src: LF and cruroplasty is feasible and has good results in terms of GERD symptoms control and additional weight loss. The high rate of postoperative complications observed in this series remains a matter of concern. A re-sleeve procedure might be considered as an alternative to RYGB/DS conversion restricted to selected patients.

text:
Q: Is the cell death in mesial temporal sclerosis apoptotic?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: These data suggest that either apoptosis is not involved in cell loss in MTS, or a very slow rate of cell demise.
label: Uncertain
question: Is the cell death in mesial temporal sclerosis apoptotic?
rationale_src: These data suggest that either apoptosis is not involved in cell loss in MTS, or a very slow rate of cell demise may have precluded detecting TUNEL-positive neurons dying through apoptosis. Increased Bax expression and activation of caspases support the latter possibility.

text:
Q: Gluten tolerance in adult patients with celiac disease 20 years after diagnosis?
A: Uncertain. Rationale: Development of tolerance to gluten seems possible in some patients with CD.
label: Uncertain
question: Gluten tolerance in adult patients with celiac disease 20 years after diagnosis?
rationale_src: Development of tolerance to gluten seems possible in some patients with CD. Further follow-up will show whether this tolerance is permanent or only a long-term return to latency. This feature may be associated with genetic characteristics, especially with HLA genotypes that differ from DQ2 or DQ8. More insight into the mechanisms of the development of gluten tolerance may help to distinguish those CD patients that might not require life-long GFD.

text:
Q: Does prednisolone inhibit proliferation of cultured pulmonary artery smooth muscle cells of patients with idiopathic pulmonary arterial hypertension?
A: Yes. Rationale: Our results indicate that PSL has an antiproliferative effect on cultured SMCs of pulmonary arteries from patients with IPAH and suggest that.
label: Yes
question: Does prednisolone inhibit proliferation of cultured pulmonary artery smooth muscle cells of patients with idiopathic pulmonary arterial hypertension?
rationale_src: Our results indicate that PSL has an antiproliferative effect on cultured SMCs of pulmonary arteries from patients with IPAH and suggest that PSL may be potentially useful therapeutically in patients with IPAH.

text:
Q: Do large deletions play a minor but essential role in congenital coagulation factor VII and X deficiencies?
A: Yes. Rationale: Large deletions play a minor but essential role in the mutational spectrum of the F7 and F10 genes.
label: Yes
question: Do large deletions play a minor but essential role in congenital coagulation factor VII and X deficiencies?
rationale_src: Large deletions play a minor but essential role in the mutational spectrum of the F7 and F10 genes. Copy number analyses (e. g. MLPA) should be considered if sequencing cannot clarify the underlying reason of an observed coagulopathy. Of note, in cases of combined FVII/FX deficiency, a deletion of the two contiguous genes might be part of a larger chromosomal rearrangement.

text:
Q: Do novel C8orf37 mutations cause retinitis pigmentosa in consanguineous families of Pakistani origin?
A: Yes. Rationale: In this report, we describe C8orf37 mutations that cause retinal dystrophy in two families of Pakistani origin, contributing further data on the.
label: Yes
question: Do novel C8orf37 mutations cause retinitis pigmentosa in consanguineous families of Pakistani origin?
rationale_src: In this report, we describe C8orf37 mutations that cause retinal dystrophy in two families of Pakistani origin, contributing further data on the phenotype and the spectrum of mutations in this form of retinitis pigmentosa.

text:
Q: Does canonical Wnt signaling skewer TGF-β signaling in chondrocytes towards signaling via ALK1 and Smad 1/5/8?
A: Yes. Rationale: Our data show that canonical Wnt signaling is able to skew TGF-β signaling towards dominant signaling via the ALK1/Smad 1/5/8 pathway, which.
label: Yes
question: Does canonical Wnt signaling skewer TGF-β signaling in chondrocytes towards signaling via ALK1 and Smad 1/5/8?
rationale_src: Our data show that canonical Wnt signaling is able to skew TGF-β signaling towards dominant signaling via the ALK1/Smad 1/5/8 pathway, which reportedly leads to chondrocyte hypertrophy. In this way canonical Wnts and WISP1, which we found to be increased during experimental osteoarthritis, may contribute to osteoarthritis pathology.

text:
Q: Does quantitative micro-CT based coronary artery profiling using interactive local thresholding and cylindrical coordinate?
A: Yes. Rationale: The micro-CT methodology described represents a handy and reliable tool for quantitative high resolution and contrast agent free full length coronary wall.
label: Yes
question: Does quantitative micro-CT based coronary artery profiling using interactive local thresholding and cylindrical coordinate?
rationale_src: The micro-CT methodology described represents a handy and reliable tool for quantitative high resolution and contrast agent free full length coronary wall profiling, able to assist atherosclerotic vessels morphometry in a preclinical experimental model of coronary ATS and providing a link between in vivo imaging and histology.

text:
Q: Does variation in bradykinin receptor genes increase the cardiovascular risk associated with hypertension?
A: Yes. Rationale: Common variation in the genes for the kinin B(1)and B(2)receptors influences prospective hypertensive coronary risk.
label: Yes
question: Does variation in bradykinin receptor genes increase the cardiovascular risk associated with hypertension?
rationale_src: Common variation in the genes for the kinin B(1)and B(2)receptors influences prospective hypertensive coronary risk. These are the first reported human data to suggest a role for the B(1)R in human coronary vascular disease, and the first prospective study to demonstrate a similar role for the B(2)R.

text:
Q: Does anti-tumor necrosis factor alpha therapy suppress the induction of experimental autoimmune uveoretinitis in mice by inhibiting antigen priming?
A: Yes. Rationale: Neutralization of systemic TNF ameliorates EAU.
label: Yes
question: Does anti-tumor necrosis factor alpha therapy suppress the induction of experimental autoimmune uveoretinitis in mice by inhibiting antigen priming?
rationale_src: Neutralization of systemic TNF ameliorates EAU. The effectiveness of afferent treatment in comparison to the treatment during the efferent stage, together with the reduced proliferation and the reduced abundance of IRBP-responsive cells, suggest that interference with afferent-acting processes such as antigen priming is important to achieve protection from EAU by anti-TNF treatment.

text:
Q: Does growth hormone treatment enhance the functional recovery of sciatic nerves after transection and repair?
A: Yes. Rationale: GH enhanced the functional recovery of the damaged nerves, thus supporting the use of GH treatment, alone or combined with other therapeutic.
label: Yes
question: Does growth hormone treatment enhance the functional recovery of sciatic nerves after transection and repair?
rationale_src: GH enhanced the functional recovery of the damaged nerves, thus supporting the use of GH treatment, alone or combined with other therapeutic approaches, in promoting nerve repair.

text:
Q: Is surface vimentin critical for the cell entry of SARS-CoV?
A: Yes. Rationale: A direct interaction between vimentin and SARS-CoV spike protein during viral entry was observed.
label: Yes
question: Is surface vimentin critical for the cell entry of SARS-CoV?
rationale_src: A direct interaction between vimentin and SARS-CoV spike protein during viral entry was observed. Vimentin is a putative anti-viral drug target for preventing/reducing the susceptibility to SARS-CoV infection.

text:
Q: Does negative reinforcement reveal non-evoked ongoing pain in mice with tissue or nerve injury?
A: Yes. Rationale: We demonstrated the presence of non-evoked ongoing pain in mice with chronic inflammation or following nerve injury.
label: Yes
question: Does negative reinforcement reveal non-evoked ongoing pain in mice with tissue or nerve injury?
rationale_src: We demonstrated the presence of non-evoked ongoing pain in mice with chronic inflammation or following nerve injury. The study also validates the use of negative reinforcement to unmask non-evoked pain in mice. We propose to apply this approach to identify molecular mechanisms and effective drugs for chronic pain.

text:
Q: Does alcohol induce relaxation of rat thoracic aorta and mesenteric arterial bed?
A: Yes. Rationale: Alcohol has a vasodilating effect on rat artery depending on the resting tension.
label: Yes
question: Does alcohol induce relaxation of rat thoracic aorta and mesenteric arterial bed?
rationale_src: Alcohol has a vasodilating effect on rat artery depending on the resting tension. Both extracellular and intracellular Ca(2+) mobilization of vascular smooth muscle cells are involved in the vascular effect of alcohol.
